intro: Lippia vernonioides f. subtruncata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lippia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its foliage is used in traditional medicine for its purported antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. The subspecies subtruncata is distinguished by its truncate leaf tips and compact growth habit.
